title: Numbers Chapter 28 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Numbers chapter 28 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Numbers Chapter 28 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Numbers Chapter 28.

questions.question: According to Numbers 28:3, what was the daily offering made by fire to the LORD?
options: Two lambs of the first year without spot
One bullock and one ram
Seven lambs of the first year
One kid of the goats
questions.correctAnswer: Two lambs of the first year without spot
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:3 specifies that the daily burnt offering was two lambs of the first year without spot.

questions.question: What time of day were the two lambs offered as burnt offerings according to Numbers 28:4?
options: One in the morning and one in the evening
Both in the morning
Both in the evening
At noon and midnight
questions.correctAnswer: One in the morning and one in the evening
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:4 states that one lamb is offered in the morning and the other in the evening.

questions.question: What was mixed with flour for the meat offering according to Numbers 28:5?
options: Beaten oil
Honey
Water
Wine
questions.correctAnswer: Beaten oil
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:5 explains that a tenth part of an ephah of flour was mingled with a fourth part of an hin of beaten oil for the meat offering.

questions.question: According to Numbers 28:7, what was poured as a drink offering in the holy place?
options: Strong wine
Water
Oil
Milk
questions.correctAnswer: Strong wine
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:7 states that the drink offering was the fourth part of an hin of strong wine poured in the holy place.

questions.question: How many lambs were offered on the Sabbath day according to Numbers 28:9?
options: Two lambs of the first year without spot
Seven lambs
One lamb
Three lambs
questions.correctAnswer: Two lambs of the first year without spot
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:9 specifies that on the sabbath day, two lambs of the first year without spot were offered.

questions.question: True or False: Numbers 28:11 commands offering seven young bullocks every month.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:11 states two young bullocks, one ram, and seven lambs were offered monthly, not seven bullocks.

questions.question: What kind of goat was offered as a sin offering according to Numbers 28:15?
options: One kid of the goats
A male goat without blemish
Seven goats
A ram goat
questions.correctAnswer: One kid of the goats
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:15 mentions one kid of the goats was offered for a sin offering.

questions.question: On which day of the first month is the Passover celebrated according to Numbers 28:16?
options: Fourteenth day
First day
Seventh day
Fifteenth day
questions.correctAnswer: Fourteenth day
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:16 states that the Passover of the LORD is on the fourteenth day of the first month.

questions.question: How many days shall unleavened bread be eaten during the feast according to Numbers 28:17?
options: Seven days
Three days
One day
Ten days
questions.correctAnswer: Seven days
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:17 says that seven days shall unleavened bread be eaten during the feast.

questions.question: True or False: On the first day of the feast in the first month, servile work is permitted according to Numbers 28:18.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:18 commands a holy convocation on the first day where no servile work should be done.

questions.question: What animals were offered as burnt offerings on the first day of the feast according to Numbers 28:19?
options: Two young bullocks, one ram, and seven lambs
One bullock and one ram
Seven goats
Three rams and five lambs
questions.correctAnswer: Two young bullocks, one ram, and seven lambs
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:19 specifies the burnt offerings as two young bullocks, one ram, and seven lambs without blemish.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Numbers 28:20 states the meat offering for a bullock is _______ deals of flour mingled with oil.
options: Three tenth
Two tenth
One tenth
Four tenth
questions.correctAnswer: Three tenth
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:20 declares the meat offering for a bullock is three tenth deals of flour mingled with oil.

questions.question: True or False: Numbers 28:25 commands a holy convocation on the seventh day of the feast with no servile work.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:25 commands a holy convocation and forbids servile work on the seventh day.

questions.question: According to Numbers 28:26, when bringing a new meat offering to the LORD, what must the Israelites do?
options: Have a holy convocation and do no servile work
Offer only one lamb
Fast for the day
Perform a burnt offering only on the next day
questions.correctAnswer: Have a holy convocation and do no servile work
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:26 commands a holy convocation and forbids servile work on the day of firstfruits when a new meat offering is brought.

questions.question: What was the drink offering for a bullock during the monthly burnt offering according to Numbers 28:14?
options: Half an hin of wine
A fourth part of an hin of wine
One hin of oil
Two hin of water
questions.correctAnswer: Half an hin of wine
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:14 states the drink offering for a bullock was half an hin of wine.

medium.title: Numbers Chapter 28 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Numbers Chapter 28 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Numbers 28 teach us about faithfulness and daily devotion in our relationship with God?
options: By requiring two lambs without blemish to be offered every morning and evening
By allowing offerings only once a month
By focusing solely on sin offerings
By encouraging offerings only on special feast days
questions.correctAnswer: By requiring two lambs without blemish to be offered every morning and evening
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:3-4 commands daily burnt offerings of two lambs without blemish, morning and evening, teaching us the importance of continual faithfulness and devotion to God.

questions.question: A believer questions the importance of regular prayer and worship. Based on Numbers 28, what principle about spiritual discipline can you share?
options: Regular offerings and sacrifices were made daily, showing consistent devotion
Offerings were only required on rare occasions
Sacrifices were optional based on personal preference
Only the priests were responsible for sacrifices
questions.correctAnswer: Regular offerings and sacrifices were made daily, showing consistent devotion
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:6-8 emphasize the continual burnt offering ordained at Sinai, signifying the need for daily spiritual discipline and consistent worship.

questions.question: What does Numbers 28 teach about the value of obedience in family and church life?
options: The children of Israel were commanded to observe offerings in their due season
Only the elders were responsible for offerings
Offerings could be postponed without consequence
Sacrifices were made only when convenient
questions.correctAnswer: The children of Israel were commanded to observe offerings in their due season
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:2 directs the children of Israel to present offerings in their appointed times, illustrating the importance of obedience and timely participation within the community and family.

questions.question: How does Numbers 28 encourage generosity and stewardship through its instructions on offerings?
options: By prescribing specific quantities of animals and flour for offerings
By allowing people to give whatever they want
By focusing only on monetary donations
By discouraging regular giving
questions.correctAnswer: By prescribing specific quantities of animals and flour for offerings
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:11-14 specifies exact numbers and measurements for offerings, showing how careful stewardship and faithful giving honor God.

questions.question: A fellow believer struggles with maintaining integrity at work. Based on Numbers 28, what biblical truth about consistency and integrity can you share?
options: Consistent daily offerings symbolize the importance of integrity in all tasks
Work can be avoided if it conflicts with worship
Integrity is only important during holy days
Offerings are unrelated to personal conduct
questions.correctAnswer: Consistent daily offerings symbolize the importance of integrity in all tasks
questions.explanation: The continual burnt offering described in Numbers 28:3-6 demonstrates daily commitment and consistency, reflecting how integrity should permeate all areas of life, including work.

questions.question: What lesson on humility and contentment is found in the prescribed offerings in Numbers 28?
options: Offerings must be without blemish, showing respect and humility before God
Offerings can be made from imperfect animals
The size of the offering is based on personal wealth
Only wealthy people are required to offer sacrifices
questions.correctAnswer: Offerings must be without blemish, showing respect and humility before God
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:3, 19, and 31 emphasize that offerings be without blemish, teaching humility and reverence in our giving and worship.

questions.question: How does Numbers 28 address perseverance through trials and spiritual discipline?
options: By requiring daily and monthly offerings regardless of circumstances
By allowing offerings to be skipped during hardships
By focusing on offerings only during festivals
By requiring sacrifices only when convenient
questions.correctAnswer: By requiring daily and monthly offerings regardless of circumstances
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:3-6 and 11-14 instruct continual daily and monthly offerings, encouraging perseverance and steadfastness in spiritual disciplines even in difficult times.

questions.question: True or False: According to Numbers 28, the sabbath day requires two lambs without blemish as burnt offerings beside the continual burnt offering.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:9-10 clearly states that on the sabbath day two lambs without blemish are offered alongside the continual burnt offering.

questions.question: True or False: Numbers 28 teaches that no servile work should be done on the first and seventh days of the feast of unleavened bread.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:18 and 28:25 instruct that on the first and seventh days of the feast there shall be a holy convocation with no servile work done.

questions.question: During the feast of unleavened bread, how many young bullocks, rams, and lambs must be offered according to Numbers 28?
options: Two young bullocks, one ram, and seven lambs without blemish
One young bullock, two rams, and five lambs
Three young bullocks, two rams, and ten lambs
No animals are required, only grain offerings
questions.correctAnswer: Two young bullocks, one ram, and seven lambs without blemish
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:19 specifies that during the feast, two young bullocks, one ram, and seven lambs without blemish are to be offered as burnt offerings.

questions.question: What biblical truth about forgiveness and reconciliation can be drawn from the sin offerings described in Numbers 28?
options: A kid of the goats is offered as a sin offering to make atonement
Sin offerings were optional and not important
Only priests could offer sin offerings
Sin offerings were replaced by grain offerings
questions.correctAnswer: A kid of the goats is offered as a sin offering to make atonement
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:15, 22, and 30 show that a kid of the goats is specifically offered for sin, teaching the importance of atonement and forgiveness through sacrifice.

questions.question: How does Numbers 28 instruct believers about the importance of spiritual fellowship and worship on the day of firstfruits?
options: There shall be a holy convocation with no servile work and specific burnt offerings
It is a normal workday with no special requirements
Only private prayer is needed
Offerings are optional on this day
questions.correctAnswer: There shall be a holy convocation with no servile work and specific burnt offerings
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:26-31 directs a holy convocation with no servile work and prescribed burnt offerings, emphasizing corporate worship and fellowship.

questions.question: According to Numbers 28, what can we learn about gratitude through the offerings prescribed for the beginning of each month?
options: Specific and plentiful offerings are given as a sweet savour to the LORD
No offerings are required at the beginning of the month
Only small offerings of grain are necessary
Offerings can be skipped if the people are busy
questions.correctAnswer: Specific and plentiful offerings are given as a sweet savour to the LORD
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:11-14 describe a detailed burnt offering with bulls, rams, lambs, flour, oil, and wine, demonstrating an attitude of thankfulness and dedication.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The drink offering for the bullock at the beginning of the month is _______ according to Numbers 28.
options: half an hin of wine
a quarter of an hin of wine
one hin of wine
three quarters of an hin of wine
questions.correctAnswer: half an hin of wine
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:14 specifies that the drink offering for the bullock is half an hin of wine, showing the detailed attention to offerings as expressions of worship.

questions.question: What does Numbers 28 teach about the importance of honoring God through sacrificial offerings and worship in family and community life?
options: Offerings and sacrifices must be done regularly and without blemish, reflecting reverence
Sacrifices are only symbolic and not required regularly
Only priests need to participate in sacrifices
Offerings can be substituted with voluntary acts
questions.correctAnswer: Offerings and sacrifices must be done regularly and without blemish, reflecting reverence
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:3, 9, 19, and 31 emphasize regular, unblemished offerings, teaching families and communities the value of reverent and obedient worship.

hard.title: Numbers Chapter 28 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Numbers Chapter 28.

questions.question: What is the significance of the continual burnt offering described in Numbers 28, and how does it function within the ritual system?
options: It symbolizes Israel's ongoing atonement and dedication to God offered daily
It commemorates the Exodus from Egypt annually
It is a once-a-year sacrifice for national sin
It represents the covenant renewal ceremony
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes Israel's ongoing atonement and dedication to God offered daily
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:3-6 describe the daily offering of two lambs as a continual burnt offering, signifying constant atonement and devotion to God.

questions.question: In Numbers 28:5, what is the significance of the measurement 'a tenth part of an ephah' of flour in the grain offering?
options: It reflects a precise, divinely ordained quantity symbolizing completeness
It was a flexible, approximate measure used only occasionally
It was a large measure indicating abundance
It was symbolic of the harvest festival only
questions.correctAnswer: It reflects a precise, divinely ordained quantity symbolizing completeness
questions.explanation: The use of exact measurements like 'a tenth part of an ephah' denotes God's specific instructions for offerings, emphasizing order and holiness (Numbers 28:5).

questions.question: How does the description of the sabbath offerings in Numbers 28:9-10 connect to the concept of sacred time in ancient Israel?
options: They provide additional burnt offerings to honor the sanctity of the sabbath beyond the daily sacrifice
They replace the daily offerings entirely on the sabbath
They are voluntary offerings not required on the sabbath
They symbolize the agricultural rest rather than spiritual rest
questions.correctAnswer: They provide additional burnt offerings to honor the sanctity of the sabbath beyond the daily sacrifice
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:9-10 commands two lambs as burnt offerings on the sabbath, supplementing the continual burnt offering to mark the day's holiness.

questions.question: What is the role of the drink offering described throughout Numbers 28, particularly in verses 7-8 and 14?
options: It complements the burnt and grain offerings, symbolizing the offering of one's entire being to God
It serves as a substitute for animal sacrifice
It is a ritual for healing and purification only
It represents a communal feast for the priests
questions.correctAnswer: It complements the burnt and grain offerings, symbolizing the offering of one's entire being to God
questions.explanation: The drink offering poured out with the sacrifices (Numbers 28:7-8, 14) symbolizes complete devotion and is an integral part of the sacrificial system.

questions.question: The monthly offerings in Numbers 28:11-15 include young bullocks, rams, lambs, and a kid goat. What theological theme do these diverse offerings collectively emphasize?
options: The comprehensive nature of atonement and praise to the LORD throughout time
The exclusivity of animal sacrifices over grain offerings
The focus on sin offerings only
The rejection of earlier Canaanite cultic practices
questions.correctAnswer: The comprehensive nature of atonement and praise to the LORD throughout time
questions.explanation: The variety and number of animals offered monthly (Numbers 28:11-15) reflect ongoing, multifaceted worship and atonement, underscoring God's continual presence.

questions.question: How does the offering of a kid goat as a sin offering (Numbers 28:15, 30) relate typologically to later New Testament atonement concepts?
options: It foreshadows Christ as the ultimate sin offering who atones once for all
It represents a permanent, repeated atonement like in the Mosaic Law only
It is unrelated to New Testament theology
It symbolizes the necessity of animal death for agricultural fertility
questions.correctAnswer: It foreshadows Christ as the ultimate sin offering who atones once for all
questions.explanation: The sin offering of a kid goat in Numbers prefigures the New Testament teaching of Christ’s sacrifice as the perfect atonement (Hebrews 10:4-10).

questions.question: According to Numbers 28:16-31, what is the relationship between the Passover feast and the subsequent seven days of unleavened bread in terms of sacrificial offerings?
options: The Passover initiates the feast with special offerings, followed by daily sacrifices during the seven days
The feast replaces all sacrifices during the week
The Passover requires no offerings, only the feast
The offerings are identical every day without distinction
questions.correctAnswer: The Passover initiates the feast with special offerings, followed by daily sacrifices during the seven days
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:16-24 outlines the Passover on the 14th with special sacrifices and the seven days of unleavened bread with daily offerings, showing a liturgical flow.

questions.question: What literary device is evident in Numbers 28:19-22 with the repeated pattern of animal offerings and their corresponding grain and drink offerings?
options: Parallelism emphasizing completeness and order in worship
Chiasm highlighting the centrality of the ram
Metaphor for Israel’s national identity
Allegory of the covenant promises
questions.correctAnswer: Parallelism emphasizing completeness and order in worship
questions.explanation: The structured repetition of bullocks, rams, lambs, and grain offerings (Numbers 28:19-22) exemplifies parallelism, underscoring ritual precision.

questions.question: In Numbers 28:26-31, what is the significance of the 'day of the firstfruits' in the cultic calendar?
options: It marks the conclusion of the weeks and includes a holy convocation with specific offerings
It is a minor festival with no special sacrifices
It commemorates the giving of the law at Sinai
It is a fast day with no offerings
questions.correctAnswer: It marks the conclusion of the weeks and includes a holy convocation with specific offerings
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:26-31 describes the day of firstfruits as a feast with holy convocation and detailed offerings, concluding the counting of weeks.

questions.question: True or False: The continual burnt offering described in Numbers 28 was only to be offered during special festivals and not daily.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:3-6 makes clear the continual burnt offering was to be offered daily, morning and evening, not only during festivals.

questions.question: How does the command to offer sacrifices 'without blemish' (Numbers 28:19, 31) reflect the theological concept of holiness in the ancient Israelite sacrificial system?
options: It emphasizes the need for purity and perfection in offerings to God
It indicates that only old or weak animals were acceptable
It suggests animals could be offered with defects if necessary
It symbolizes human sinfulness and imperfection
questions.correctAnswer: It emphasizes the need for purity and perfection in offerings to God
questions.explanation: The requirement that sacrifices be 'without blemish' signifies that only perfect, holy offerings are acceptable to God (Numbers 28:19, 31).

questions.question: What is the cultural and historical significance of the oil 'beaten' or 'mingled' with flour in the grain offerings as described in Numbers 28:5 and 12-13?
options: Oil was a symbol of consecration and abundance, enhancing the offering's value
Oil was used to replace animal sacrifice in famine times
Oil was a common cooking ingredient with no ritual significance
Oil was employed only for medicinal purposes in sacrifices
questions.correctAnswer: Oil was a symbol of consecration and abundance, enhancing the offering's value
questions.explanation: The addition of beaten oil to flour in offerings symbolized consecration and the gift of abundance to God (Numbers 28:5, 12-13).

questions.question: The repeated phrase 'a sweet savour unto the LORD' found in Numbers 28 conveys what theological meaning in the context of burnt offerings?
options: It signifies that the offering is pleasing and acceptable to God
It indicates the offering is fragrant for human enjoyment
It refers to a specific type of incense used in sacrifices
It means the sacrifice is eaten by the priests
questions.correctAnswer: It signifies that the offering is pleasing and acceptable to God
questions.explanation: The phrase 'sweet savour unto the LORD' indicates the offerings are accepted and pleasing to God as per Numbers 28:2, 6, and others.

questions.question: How does the detailed sacrificial system in Numbers 28 serve an educational purpose for the Israelites regarding their relationship with God?
options: It teaches obedience, holiness, and the need for continual atonement
It primarily functions as a social gathering with no spiritual meaning
It emphasizes human merit over divine grace
It replaces moral behavior with ritual compliance
questions.correctAnswer: It teaches obedience, holiness, and the need for continual atonement
questions.explanation: The prescribed offerings in Numbers 28 instruct the Israelites on God’s holiness and their need for ongoing atonement and obedience.

questions.question: The use of the term 'holy convocation' in Numbers 28:18 and 25 primarily indicates what about the nature of certain days in the Israelite calendar?
options: They are set apart for communal worship and rest from servile work
They are optional days for personal reflection
They are days for agricultural labor only
They are days for mourning and fasting
questions.correctAnswer: They are set apart for communal worship and rest from servile work
questions.explanation: 'Holy convocation' marks sacred assemblies where work is prohibited and communal worship is commanded (Numbers 28:18, 25).

theological.title: Numbers Chapter 28 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Numbers Chapter 28 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Numbers 28, what is the significance of the continual burnt offering of two lambs daily?
options: It symbolizes constant atonement and worship before God
It commemorates the Exodus from Egypt
It marks the beginning of the Sabbath
It is a ritual for cleansing the tabernacle
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes constant atonement and worship before God
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:3-6 describes the continual burnt offering of two lambs daily as a 'sacrifice made by fire unto the LORD' for a 'sweet savour', indicating ongoing atonement and worship. This continual offering foreshadows Christ's perpetual intercession (Hebrews 7:25), aligns with God's desire for continual fellowship (Psalm 34:1), and prefigures the ultimate sacrifice (Hebrews 10:12).

questions.question: What elements accompany the burnt offering in the daily sacrifice described in Numbers 28?
options: Flour mingled with oil and a drink offering of wine
Only the lamb without any additional offerings
Incense and a grain offering
Salt and frankincense
questions.correctAnswer: Flour mingled with oil and a drink offering of wine
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:5-7 specifies that the burnt offering is accompanied by a tenth of an ephah of flour mixed with oil as a meat offering, and a drink offering of a fourth part of an hin of wine, emphasizing the completeness and sweetness of the sacrifice. This combination is echoed in Leviticus 2:1-2 and symbolizes the dedication of one's whole being to God (Romans 12:1).

questions.question: On the Sabbath day, what additional sacrifices are commanded beyond the continual burnt offering?
options: Two lambs, two-tenths of flour mingled with oil, and their drink offerings
One bullock and one ram without blemish
A kid of the goats for a sin offering
Seven lambs and a ram
questions.correctAnswer: Two lambs, two-tenths of flour mingled with oil, and their drink offerings
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:9-10 instructs that on the Sabbath, two lambs of the first year without spot, two-tenths of flour mingled with oil, and their drink offerings must be offered beside the continual burnt offering. This highlights the Sabbath as a special covenantal day of rest and worship (Exodus 20:8-11), signifying God’s provision and grace.

questions.question: What is the prescribed burnt offering for the beginnings of each month according to Numbers 28?
options: Two young bullocks, one ram, and seven lambs without blemish
Two goats and a ram
Seven bulls and a ram
One bullock and two rams
questions.correctAnswer: Two young bullocks, one ram, and seven lambs without blemish
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:11-13 prescribes that at the start of each month, two young bullocks, one ram, and seven lambs of the first year without blemish are to be offered, emphasizing the ceremonial dedication of time to God and the renewal of covenant relationship (Psalm 81:3-4). This pointing towards God's sovereignty over time and creation (Genesis 1:14).

questions.question: What additional offering is made beside the burnt offerings at the beginning of each month?
options: One kid of the goats as a sin offering
An offering of incense
A grain offering of barley
A peace offering of oxen
questions.correctAnswer: One kid of the goats as a sin offering
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:15 specifies that at the beginning of each month, one kid of the goats is offered as a sin offering beside the continual burnt offering. This underscores the ongoing need for atonement for sin even amidst regular worship, reflecting God's justice and mercy (Leviticus 4:27-31; Hebrews 9:22).

questions.question: What is the significance of the festival beginning on the fourteenth day of the first month as described in Numbers 28?
options: It is the Passover of the LORD
It is the Day of Atonement
It is the Feast of Tabernacles
It is the Feast of Weeks
questions.correctAnswer: It is the Passover of the LORD
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:16 identifies the fourteenth day of the first month as the Passover of the LORD, commemorating Israel’s deliverance from Egypt. The Passover foreshadows Christ as the true Passover Lamb (1 Corinthians 5:7), emphasizing salvation through the blood of the Lamb and God's redemptive plan (Exodus 12; John 1:29).

questions.question: During the seven days of the feast starting on the fifteenth day of the first month, what is commanded regarding work and worship?
options: There shall be a holy convocation and no servile work
Work is permitted but no sacrifices are offered
Only the priests may work
Sacrifices are suspended during this period
questions.correctAnswer: There shall be a holy convocation and no servile work
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:17-18 and 25 command a holy convocation on the first and seventh days of the feast where no servile work is to be done, emphasizing consecrated worship and rest. This highlights God’s call for His people to set apart time for Him (Leviticus 23:3; Hebrews 4:9-10).

questions.question: What is the composition of the burnt offering on the first day of the feast as given in Numbers 28?
options: Two young bullocks, one ram, and seven lambs without blemish
One young bullock and seven lambs
Three rams and one bullock
Two goats and one bullock
questions.correctAnswer: Two young bullocks, one ram, and seven lambs without blemish
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:19 details the burnt offering on the first day of the feast as two young bullocks, one ram, and seven lambs without blemish, all signifying perfect and acceptable offerings to God. This stresses the holiness required before God (Leviticus 1:3; Hebrews 9:14) and points to Christ’s sinlessness.

questions.question: What kind of meat offering accompanies the daily burnt offerings during the feast as prescribed in Numbers 28?
options: Flour mingled with oil in specific measures for bullocks, rams, and lambs
Only oil without flour
Incense and frankincense
Grain and salt
questions.correctAnswer: Flour mingled with oil in specific measures for bullocks, rams, and lambs
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:20-21 describes the meat offering as flour mingled with oil in precise portions for each animal, symbolizing the dedication of the entire offering to God. This reflects the biblical principle of offering our best to God (Malachi 1:8; Romans 12:1).

questions.question: What additional offering is made for atonement during the feast, as described in Numbers 28?
options: One goat for a sin offering
A lamb for a peace offering
A bullock for a burnt offering
A young ram for a grain offering
questions.correctAnswer: One goat for a sin offering
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:22 specifies the offering of one goat for a sin offering during the feast to make atonement, emphasizing the necessity of cleansing from sin for fellowship with God (Leviticus 16:15; Hebrews 9:7).

questions.question: How are the daily offerings during the seven days of the feast described in Numbers 28?
options: They are to be offered beside the continual burnt offering and its drink offering
They are to be offered only on the first and last day
They replace the continual burnt offering
They are optional and left to the people's discretion
questions.correctAnswer: They are to be offered beside the continual burnt offering and its drink offering
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:24 states that daily offerings during the seven days are to be made beside the continual burnt offering and drink offering, showing the integration of special festival worship with ongoing daily atonement (Psalm 51:17; Hebrews 10:1-4).

questions.question: What is commanded for the day of firstfruits after the weeks are completed, as per Numbers 28?
options: A holy convocation with no servile work and specific burnt offerings
A day of fasting and mourning
An offering of only grain and wine
A sacrifice of a bullock only
questions.correctAnswer: A holy convocation with no servile work and specific burnt offerings
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:26-27 commands a holy convocation with no servile work on the day of firstfruits, with burnt offerings including two young bullocks, one ram, and seven lambs without blemish, highlighting thanksgiving and dedication to God (Leviticus 23:9-14; 1 Corinthians 15:20).

questions.question: What are the measures of the meat offerings and drink offerings for the monthly burnt offerings described in Numbers 28?
options: Three-tenths of flour for a bullock, two-tenths for a ram, and a several tenth for each lamb; half a hin of wine for a bullock, a third for a ram, and a fourth for a lamb
One-tenth of flour and a full hin of wine for all offerings
Only oil is required without flour or wine
No meat or drink offerings accompany the burnt offerings
questions.correctAnswer: Three-tenths of flour for a bullock, two-tenths for a ram, and a several tenth for each lamb; half a hin of wine for a bullock, a third for a ram, and a fourth for a lamb
questions.explanation: Numbers 28:12-14 details the exact measurements of flour mingled with oil for the meat offerings and the quantities of wine for the drink offerings, signifying precision and reverence in worship, reflecting God's holiness (Leviticus 2:1-4; Ezekiel 45:15-17).

questions.question: What does the repeated mention of offerings 'without blemish' in Numbers 28 signify about God's requirements?
options: God requires perfect and unblemished sacrifices as a symbol of purity and holiness
Any animal is acceptable as long as it is offered
Only animals with scars are accepted
Blemished animals can be offered during special occasions
questions.correctAnswer: God requires perfect and unblemished sacrifices as a symbol of purity and holiness
questions.explanation: Verses such as Numbers 28:3, 11, 19, and 31 emphasize offerings 'without spot' or 'without blemish', highlighting God's demand for holiness and perfection in what is presented to Him. This prefigures Christ's sinlessness (1 Peter 1:19) and God's pure standards (Leviticus 22:21).

questions.question: How does Numbers 28 portray God's attribute of sovereignty over time and worship?
options: By instituting specific offerings for daily, weekly, monthly, and festival times
By allowing worship only once a year
By leaving worship timing to individual choice
By forbidding sacrifices on holy days
questions.correctAnswer: By instituting specific offerings for daily, weekly, monthly, and festival times
questions.explanation: Numbers 28 outlines offerings for daily (verses 3-8), weekly (verses 9-10), monthly (verses 11-15), and festival times (verses 16-31), demonstrating God's sovereign ordering of time and worship. This reflects God's lordship over creation and sacred time (Psalm 104:19; Ecclesiastes 3:1).
